title: [K-12] Preparatory Course for Comprehensive Pharmacy Exam (Socioscientific Approach) Using Poster-Based Collaborative Learning: Strengthening Medical Ethics and Citizenship

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational pharmaceutical knowledge, clinical pharmacy practice experience, basic social relationship-building and civic awareness, and introductory understanding of community health issues
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric, limited technological environments, emphasizing citizenship (community responsibility, democratic decision-making) and collaboration through team-based projects and peer feedback. Includes pharmaceutical knowledge applications for solving community health issues (infectious disease management, health disparity reduction).

learning_goals: Learners can systematically organize drug treatment strategies for major diseases within sociocultural contexts and healthcare systems through poster creation.
Through peer evaluation and discussion, learners can simultaneously enhance their ability to develop treatment plans and sociocommunicative skills (citizen engagement, rights advocacy, etc.).
Via poster-based learning activities, learners can master â‰¥80% of core concepts (medical ethics, patient rights, public health policies, etc.) required for comprehensive exams (NAPLEX-style).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
